titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Starkovich Ephemera Collection

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections, University of Washington Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Mark Carlson via XSLT stylesheet conversion from Millennium MARC records 2007
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

change.item: Previously cataloged pamphlet collection merged with 0305-001. Entire collection inventoried. Emily Dominick

repository.corpname: University of Washington Libraries Special Collections

did.unittitle: George Starkovich ephemera collection
did.abstract: Ephemeral materials covering topics such as U.S. Community party and various labor unions

bioghist.p: George Starkovich was a senior gardener at the University of Washington and the local president of Washington Federation of State Employees Local 1488 president. He was very active as a planner and participant in the 1999 World Trade Organization Seattle Ministerial Conference protests. George Starkovich began working as a gardener at the University of Washington in January of 1965, and quickly became involved in an organizing drive on behalf of his union, WFSE Local 1488. Starkovich was an experienced union organizer who had served as secretary of a miner’s union and shop steward at a plywood plant in Bellingham.

list.item: Accession No. 0305-001, George Starkovich collection of sociopolitical pamphlets and papers, 1935-1957
Accession No. 0305-002, George Starkovich materials regarding the WTO 1999 Seattle Ministerial Conference protests, 1999-2000

scopecontent.p: Ephemeral materials covering topics such as U.S. Community party and various labor unions. Contains pamphlets and papers related to sociopolitical issues like women, immigrants, workers, and civil rights from the 1930s through 1950s. Flyers, newsletters, meeting agendas, and newsclippings relating to George Starkovich's role as a planner and participant in the 1999 World Trade Organization Seattle Ministerial Conference protests.

userestrict.p: Creator's literary rights not transferred to the University of Washington Libraries.

Civic Activism

did.unittitle: George Starkovich collection of sociopolitical pamphlets and papers

scopecontent.p: Series 1 contains organizational records of the Civil Rights Congress, A.F.L & C.I.O Committee, Communist Party of the U.S.A, and others. Series 2 contains pamphlets and papers related to sociopolitical issues like women, immigrants, workers, and civil rights from the 1930s through 1950s. Additionally, the pamphlets and papers cover American concerns following World War II and during the rise of Cold War tensions.

processinfo.p: Series 2 of this collection was previously cataloged as a print materials collection (HX15 .S72); it has been combined with materials from Series 1 to create one collection with item level description. The collection was rehoused into pamphlet boxes.

userestrict.p: Creator's literary rights not transferred to the University of Washington Libraries.

George Starkovich materials regarding the WTO 1999 Seattle Ministerial Conference protests

physdesc.extent: .21 cubic ft (1 legal size document case)

scopecontent.p: Flyers, newsletters, meeting agendas, and newsclippings relating to George Starkovich's role as a planner and participant in the 1999 World Trade Organization Seattle Ministerial Conference protests.

userestrict.p: Creator's literary rights transferred to the University of Washington Libraries.
